alert.note: Alert for Dunn; McLean; Mountrail (North Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 10 at 6:13PM CDT by NWS Bismarck
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHEASTERN DUNN, WESTERN MCLEAN, AND EASTERN MOUNTRAIL COUNTIES THROUGH 645 PM CDT/545 PM MDT/... At 612 PM CDT/512 PM MDT/, strong thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 6 miles northeast of Belden to 11 miles south of Van Hook Park. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. These storms will remain over mainly rural areas of northeastern Dunn, western McLean and eastern Mountrail Counties, including the following locations... Deep Water Creek Recreation Area, Raub, Skunk Creek Bay Recreation Area, Tagus, Parshall Bay Recreation Area, and Pouch Point Recreation Area. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If on or near Lake Sakakawea, get out of the water and move indoors or inside a vehicle. Remember, lightning can strike out to 10 miles from the parent thunderstorm. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Move to safe shelter now! Do not be caught on the water in a thunderstorm.
